description: You can use DescribeExecution to check the details of the execution of the specified workflow.

parameters.name: ExecutionId
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the execution of a workflow.

parameters.name: WorkflowId
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the workflow.

nested_items.name: WorkflowId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for the workflow.

nested_items.name: Execution
nested_items.description: The structure that contains the details of the workflow' execution.

nested_items.name: ExecutionId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for the execution of a workflow.

nested_items.name: InitialFileLocation
nested_items.description: A structure that describes the Amazon S3 or EFS file location. This is the file location when the execution begins: if the file is being copied, this is the initial (as opposed to destination) file location.

nested_items.name: S3FileLocation
nested_items.description: Specifies the S3 details for the file being used, such as bucket, ETag, and so forth.

nested_items.name: Bucket
nested_items.description: Specifies the S3 bucket that contains the file being used.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The name assigned to the file when it was created in Amazon S3. You use the object key to retrieve the object.

nested_items.name: VersionId
nested_items.description: Specifies the file version.

nested_items.name: Etag
nested_items.description: The entity tag is a hash of the object. The ETag reflects changes only to the contents of an object, not its metadata.

nested_items.name: EfsFileLocation
nested_items.description: Specifies the Amazon EFS identifier and the path for the file being used.

nested_items.name: FileSystemId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the file system, assigned by Amazon EFS.

nested_items.name: Path
nested_items.description: The pathname for the folder being used by a workflow.

nested_items.name: ServiceMetadata
nested_items.description: A container object for the session details that are associated with a workflow.

nested_items.name: UserDetails
nested_items.description: The Server ID ( ServerId), Session ID ( SessionId) and user ( UserName) make up the UserDetails.

nested_items.name: UserName
nested_items.description: A unique string that identifies a Transfer Family user associated with a server.

nested_items.name: ServerId
nested_items.description: The system-assigned unique identifier for a Transfer server instance.

nested_items.name: SessionId
nested_items.description: The system-assigned unique identifier for a session that corresponds to the workflow.

nested_items.name: ExecutionRole
nested_items.description: The IAM role associated with the execution.

nested_items.name: LoggingConfiguration
nested_items.description: The IAM logging role associated with the execution.

nested_items.name: LoggingRole
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that allows a server to turn on Amazon CloudWatch logging for Amazon S3 or Amazon EFS events. When set, you can view user activity in your CloudWatch logs.

nested_items.name: LogGroupName
nested_items.description: The name of the CloudWatch logging group for the Transfer Family server to which this workflow belongs.

nested_items.name: PosixProfile
nested_items.description: The full POSIX identity, including user ID ( Uid), group ID ( Gid), and any secondary groups IDs ( SecondaryGids), that controls your users' access to your Amazon EFS file systems. The POSIX permissions that are set on files and directories in your file system determine the level of access your users get when transferring files into and out of your Amazon EFS file systems.

nested_items.name: Uid
nested_items.description: The POSIX user ID used for all EFS operations by this user.

nested_items.name: Gid
nested_items.description: The POSIX group ID used for all EFS operations by this user.

nested_items.name: SecondaryGids
nested_items.description: The secondary POSIX group IDs used for all EFS operations by this user.
(integer) ---

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status is one of the execution. Can be in progress, completed, exception encountered, or handling the exception.

nested_items.name: Steps
nested_items.description: Specifies the details for the steps that are in the specified workflow.

nested_items.name: StepType
nested_items.description: One of the available step types.
COPY - Copy the file to another location.
CUSTOM - Perform a custom step with an Lambda function target.
DECRYPT - Decrypt a file that was encrypted before it was uploaded.
DELETE - Delete the file.
TAG - Add a tag to the file.

nested_items.name: Outputs
nested_items.description: The values for the key/value pair applied as a tag to the file. Only applicable if the step type is TAG.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: Specifies the error type.
ALREADY_EXISTS: occurs for a copy step, if the overwrite option is not selected and a file with the same name already exists in the target location.
BAD_REQUEST: a general bad request: for example, a step that attempts to tag an EFS file returns BAD_REQUEST, as only S3 files can be tagged.
CUSTOM_STEP_FAILED: occurs when the custom step provided a callback that indicates failure.
INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR: a catch-all error that can occur for a variety of reasons.
NOT_FOUND: occurs when a requested entity, for example a source file for a copy step, does not exist.
PERMISSION_DENIED: occurs if your policy does not contain the correct permissions to complete one or more of the steps in the workflow.
TIMEOUT: occurs when the execution times out.

nested_items.name: Message
nested_items.description: Specifies the descriptive message that corresponds to the ErrorType.

nested_items.name: OnExceptionSteps
nested_items.description: Specifies the steps (actions) to take if errors are encountered during execution of the workflow.

nested_items.name: StepType
nested_items.description: One of the available step types.
COPY - Copy the file to another location.
CUSTOM - Perform a custom step with an Lambda function target.
DECRYPT - Decrypt a file that was encrypted before it was uploaded.
DELETE - Delete the file.
TAG - Add a tag to the file.

nested_items.name: Outputs
nested_items.description: The values for the key/value pair applied as a tag to the file. Only applicable if the step type is TAG.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: Specifies the error type.
ALREADY_EXISTS: occurs for a copy step, if the overwrite option is not selected and a file with the same name already exists in the target location.
BAD_REQUEST: a general bad request: for example, a step that attempts to tag an EFS file returns BAD_REQUEST, as only S3 files can be tagged.
CUSTOM_STEP_FAILED: occurs when the custom step provided a callback that indicates failure.
INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR: a catch-all error that can occur for a variety of reasons.
NOT_FOUND: occurs when a requested entity, for example a source file for a copy step, does not exist.
PERMISSION_DENIED: occurs if your policy does not contain the correct permissions to complete one or more of the steps in the workflow.
TIMEOUT: occurs when the execution times out.

nested_items.name: Message
nested_items.description: Specifies the descriptive message that corresponds to the ErrorType.
